headline: JD Vance Real Sad That The ‘Scumbags’ Don’t Want To Rent Out Event Space To Him
author: Stephen Robinson
sentences: Hillbilly Elegy author and failed insult comic JD Vance was all set to have a big campaign rally at the Landing Event Center in Loveland, Ohio, when management learned that Vance’s special guest villain at the event was his new BFF, Marjorie Taylor Greene, an ignorant bigot who’s inexplicably a member of Congress.

Big Tech greases the wheels: bad reviews on Google or Facebook can ruin a small business.\n\nDoesn't matter--come hell or high water, we're having a rally tomorrow.https://www.cincinnati.com/story/news/politics/2022/01/29/j-d-vance-event-marjorie-taylor-greene-prompts-public-outcry/9267624002/\u00a0\u2026
— J.D.

A business might not want to associate with Vance, not because of Big Tech or the woke mob, but because Vance has eagerly embraced Greene’s hateful rhetoric, which tacitly and often tactlessly promotes violence.
They might not appreciate Vance calling them "scumbags.” Vance might only care about winning the support of Trump supporters, but the Landing Event Center might want to appeal to a broader audience.
Vance would probably claim that “take the country back from the scumbags” is just hyperbole, but you can’t so easily add “with votes” to the end of that fortune cookie.
Vance is a GOP Senate candidate, and he’s not the only one who — without evidence — scapegoats and demonizes Soros, a 91-year-old Holocaust survivor and philanthropist.
He’s railed against “Big Tech” censorship and argues that any fool should have the right to say whatever they want, regardless of the content, on social media.
Vance claims “Big Tech greases the wheels,” as if the Google and Facebook set out to ruin his hate rally when in reality people just used their platforms.

Vance is an opportunist who’ll say anything to get elected but Greene isn’t faking.
